newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Cockerill and UGB abandon link idea.
newsitem.headline: Cockerill and UGB abandon link idea.

text.p: Belgian steel makers Cockerill Sambre and Usines Gustave Boel (UGB) said on Wednesday that they had abandoned a project to become partners.
"Cockerill Sambre and UGB have come to the conclusion that they cannot carry out their project to become partners," the steel makers said in a statement.

"An examination of profitability, sensitivity to the economic environment and the financial needs have led to the conclusion that a lasting future for Boel could not be guaranteed without weakening Cockerill," the statement said.
Cockerill and Boel had set up a working group to look at how to keep as many jobs as possible as well as a "healthy economic environment" in Belgium's southern Walloon steel industry.

The statement said Boel needed a partner with surplus capacities in half finished products at competitive prices and which could offer "a real outlook for the future at its site in La Louviere" -- conditions Cockerill could not meet.

The two companies said they had decided after several weeks of intense study that they could not be partners because of an "absence of complementary aspects and worthwile economic synergies between the two companies."
